Blockchain with one chain

This is an attempt at what the blockchain api might look like
More information: https://helloreverb.com
Contact Info: hello@helloreverb.com
Version: 1.0.0-oas3
BasePath:/Runar16/Blockchain_with_one_chain/1.0.0
All rights reserved
http://apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html

Access

  1. APIKey KeyParamName:api_key KeyInQuery:false KeyInHeader:true

Methods

[ Jump to Models ]

Table of Contents

Default

  • post /blocks
  • post /payloads
  • post /writers
  • get /blocks
  • get /payloads
  • get /writers

Default

Up 
post /blocks
Add a block to chain (addObject)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Block (required)
Body Parameter — JSON object that you want to add to DB and chain

Return type

Chain

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "blocks" : [ {
    "payload_type" : "payload_type",
    "payload" : {
      "payload" : { },
      "key" : 0
    },
    "coordinator_ID" : 6,
    "writer_ID" : 0,
    "hash" : "hash",
    "previous_hash" : "previous_hash"
  }, {
    "payload_type" : "payload_type",
    "payload" : {
      "payload" : { },
      "key" : 0
    },
    "coordinator_ID" : 6,
    "writer_ID" : 0,
    "hash" : "hash",
    "previous_hash" : "previous_hash"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Block successfully added to chain Chain

401

Not autenticated

422

Invalid input
Up 
post /payloads
Submits a new payload to be added to blockchain (addPayload)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Payload (required)
Body Parameter — JSON object you want to add to chain

Return type

Ticket

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "id" : 0
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

201

Payload successfully recieved Ticket

422

Invalid input
Up 
post /writers
Add a new writer for chain (addWriters)

Consumes

This API call consumes the following media types via the Content-Type request header:
  • application/json

Request body

body Writer (required)
Body Parameter — JSON object for writer that you want to add to the writer list

Responses

201

Writer added successfully to chain

401

Not autenticated

403

You do not have required authorization

422

Invalid input
Up 
get /blocks
Get blockchain based on query parameters (getChain)

Query parameters

block_hash (optional)
Query Parameter — The hash of a block
writer_id (optional)
Query Parameter — The ID of the writer that wrote the block
coordinator_id (optional)
Query Parameter — The ID of the coordintor that coordinated the writing of the block
payload_type (optional)
Query Parameter — The type of the payload

Return type

Chain

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "blocks" : [ {
    "payload_type" : "payload_type",
    "payload" : {
      "payload" : { },
      "key" : 0
    },
    "coordinator_ID" : 6,
    "writer_ID" : 0,
    "hash" : "hash",
    "previous_hash" : "previous_hash"
  }, {
    "payload_type" : "payload_type",
    "payload" : {
      "payload" : { },
      "key" : 0
    },
    "coordinator_ID" : 6,
    "writer_ID" : 0,
    "hash" : "hash",
    "previous_hash" : "previous_hash"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Chain successfully found and returned Chain
Up 
get /payloads
Get all payloads waiting to be added that align with query parameters (getPayloads)

Return type

Payloads

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "payloads" : [ {
    "payload" : { },
    "key" : 0
  }, {
    "payload" : { },
    "key" : 0
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Successfully returned all payloads Payloads

401

Not autenticated
Up 
get /writers
Get the list of writers for target chain (getWriters)

Query parameters

public_key (optional)
Query Parameter — The public key of the writer
ip (optional)
Query Parameter — The ip address of the writer
port (optional)
Query Parameter — The port of the writer

Return type

Writers

Example data

Content-Type: application/json
{
  "writers" : [ {
    "port" : "port",
    "ip" : "ip",
    "key" : "key"
  }, {
    "port" : "port",
    "ip" : "ip",
    "key" : "key"
  } ]
}

Produces

This API call produces the following media types according to the Accept request header; the media type will be conveyed by the Content-Type response header.
  • application/json

Responses

200

Successfully returned all writers in chain Writers
